overview: From 2025-10-19 to 2025-10-26, Sendo-labs/reusable-workflows had 2 new PRs (3 merged), 0 new issues, and 1 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat(workflows): setup wanted workflow and release management.
topPRs.author: M4XGO
topPRs.body:
## Why
This PR addresses [this issue](https://github.com/Sendo-labs/demo-repository/issues/25).
@standujar requested reusable workflow management. I’ve set up two different workflows: releasing for general projects and npm-publish specifically for plugins.
Additionally, I’ve added a CONTRIBUTING.md to guide contributors on how to contribute to this public repository.

## How
- Added reusable workflows in .github/workflows/.
- Created a release workflow to manage different workflow versions.
- Added documentation in each workflow folder, explaining the purpose of each reusable workflow and how to use it.
- Included a minimal configuration for release-please.

topContributors.summary: Neysixx: Focused on a significant refactor of the `Sendo-labs/frontend` repository, merging a large pull request to improve the application's page structure (Sendo-labs/frontend#3). They also resolved a critical build issue by adding missing dependencies (Sendo-labs/frontend#5), while continuing to develop a new worker implementation in an open PR. This work was primarily centered on refactoring the frontend codebase.

standujar: Expanded the Sendo-labs/leaderboard by adding new projects and repositories via two pull requests (#2, #3). In addition to this feature work, they also pushed a significant number of configuration updates directly, modifying 16 files (+566/-199 lines). This activity shows a primary focus on configuration changes and feature additions.

Final check:

- High-level summary first? Yes.

M4XGO: Focused on improving the project's release infrastructure this week by establishing an automated release and NPM publishing process in the Sendo-labs/plugin-cryptoscore repository (PR #2). This foundational work involved 22 commits, with code changes primarily focused on configuration files.

tionebDotsamapha: Focused on improving project documentation this week by merging a pull request in Sendo-labs/sendo-api (#2) to update the README file. This contribution reflects a singular focus on documentation.
